name: Interphew! - Tips and Tricks for Job Interviews in Germany
keywords: Learn what makes a great interview
description: In our workshop, you will learn what a great job interview should look like using real examples. We will look at the preparatory measures, the Dos and Don'ts  and the overall structure of the interrview, including the potential questions, so that you are aware of all the important details when interviewing in the future.Date:Saturday, 20.08.2025Time:5:15 PM - 7:30 PMPlace:Hall, Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan BangaloreLanguage:English and German (B2 Level)Participation is free of charge.Seats are limited and you will receive a confirmation one day prior to start of the session.Register hereWe look forward to your participation!Whom is the course aimed at?The project is co-financed by the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF) and is aimed at third-country nationals in Germany and those about to immigrate to Germany. Students are not part of the target group.You can register if you are a third-country national and if you have one of these residence titles:Residence permitto carry out vocational training, search for a training place, recognition of foreign professional qualifications, work, job search, spouse or family reunificationVisaorvisa applicationfor the above-mentioned residence purposesEU Blue CardResidence permit according to § 24 Abs. 1 AufenthGDATA PROTECTIONPlease ensure that you've read and agree to the attached Data Protection Declaration.Data Protection Declaration AMIF(PDF, 218 KB)About the Project:This event is being offered within the framework of the AMIF Project - "Pre-Integration and Transition Management - Successfully navigating the migration process". This project supports people, who want to migrate permanently to Germany for professional or private reasons, in preparing for everyday and working life.

name: Toni Erdmann by Maren Ade

location.name: Suchitra Film Society
location.address: #36, 9th Main, B V Karanth Road  Near Post Office, Banashankari Stage II Bangalore 560070 India

description: German Kinoat theSuchitra Film Societythis Friday!Toni Erdmann (2016)is a German-Austrian comedy-drama film that revolves around a divorced Winfried Conradi, who after the death of his beloved dog adopts the alter ego of Toni Erdmann to reconnect with his workaholic daughter, Ines, who lives and works in Bucharest, Romania.The film is a thorny tale of a father and daughter from two different socio-political and emotional generations trying to reconnect. Described as a Dadaesque film, Winfried’s persona often leads to uncomfortable and awkward situations that sets the absurdist tone of the film and forces one to question the perplexing condition of humanity in the 21st century. In addition, the film also explores themes of professional dissatisfaction, the absurdity of corporate culture, familial relationships, personal fulfilment, and the search for authenticity in a hyper-capitalist world.Toni Erdmannby Maren Ade2016 | col.| 162 min. | German with English subtitlesMaren Adeis a German filmmaker known for her work as a writer, director, and producer. Ade's work is characterised by its keen observations of human relationships, nuanced characterisations, and a blend of humour and pathos. She is considered one of the leading voices in contemporary German cinema, recognised for her ability to craft emotionally compelling narratives that resonate with audiences worldwide.

name: Café Jazz Sessions in August
description: 28thedition ofCafé Jazzat the Bhavan!In the 28th Edition of Cafe Jazz Sessions watch how jazz musicians perform and mentor younger musicians.Discover how musicians use the language of jazz to have a conversation with other musicians, creatively and spontaneously onAugust 22, 2025.Started in 2022 by one of the pioneers of jazz in the city,Jagadeesh M R, Director ofThe Bangalore School of Musicand founder ofMoonArraWorld Fusion Ensemble, this is a monthly event, designed to building a community of jazz musicians in the city and foster a culture of creativity. It is a platform to connect with each other and audiences through jam sessions, lecture demonstrations and performances. The project has fostered a faithful community of musicians who participate and interactfreely with younger jazz aspirants while audiences get a rare opportunity to watch, listen and understand the creative processes in jazz.Free entry!Musicians to register via Whatsapp +91 9844245577 for a spot.

name: Flower Tools 2.0 by QRave

location.name: Indiranagar Social
location.address: Plot 37, 80 Feet Rd HAL 3rd Stage, New Tippasandra Bangalore 560075 India

description: QRave returns again for Music, Community, and Resistance!FLOWER TOOLSis a series of gatherings byQRaveblending music, community, and shared learning into a space for expression, resistance, and joy. Designed for and by queer folks, it fosters collective flourishing through DJ sets, live performances, workshops, and discussions that empower, educate, and celebrate.The second edition of FLOWER TOOLS features aFREEbeginner-level DJ workshop for anyone who isn’t a straight cis man. Led byChutney Mary, the workshop offers hands-on learning, technical guidance, and a selector showcase by participants.At its heart, FLOWER TOOLS is about reclaiming space—on the dance floor, in music, and within ourselves—through our own unique expression. Preference will be given to queer and trans folks. As slots are limited, we’ll run recurring sessions and get in touch with those who may not get in this time.WorkshopSandbox Collective, Studio 345, Cooke Town23–24 August | 2–7 pmSelector Showcase + After PartyIndiranagar Social24 August | 8 pm onwardsAttendance on all days for participants is compulsory.Chutney Marywas born at the intersection of performance art, queerness and the spirit of experimentation. She is the alter ego of interdisciplinary artist Avril Stormy Unger. Chutney Mary is a DJ, stand-up comic, MC, dancer and pushes boundaries and norms of gender, sexuality, patriarchy and societal norms through a myriad of performances.This event is supported by Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan Bangalore.

name: The Flying Dutchman by Joachim Herz
keywords: Behind the Wall - Films from East Germany
description: We invite you to a screening ofThe Flying Dutchman (1964),directed byJoachim Herz.A screening in our ongoing film seriesGerman Cinema in Focuscurated byShivani. Currently being shown are a selection ofFilms from East Germany.In order to escape her narrow and restrictive life,Senta, the daughter of a rich shipowner, seeks refuge in her fantasies and dreams. In this realm of imagination, a bold and restless sea captain,the Flying Dutchman,who is cursed to wander the seas forever appears to her. In her obsessive dreams, Senta frees this man through her love for him.Centered around the theme of"redemption through love",Der fliegende Holländeris a German-language opera with libretto and music byRichard Wagner,who conducted the premiere at the Königliches Hoftheater Dresden in 1843. The opera is based on the myths of a legendary phantom ship (The Flying Dutchman), allegedly never able to make port, but doomed to sail the sea forever.The Flying Dutchman | Der fliegende HolländerJoachim Herz1964 | 101 Min. | B&W | German with English subtitleswith the music ofRichard WagnerJoachim Herz(b. 1924, Dresden), one of the most influential and innovative European musical theater directors of the twentieth century. His 1977 debut at theBerlin Komische Operwas with theBrecht & Weillsatirical operaRise and Fall of the City of Mahagonny, which was also recorded for East German television. His subsequent staging of The Flying Dutchman in 1962, at the invitation of Walter Felsenstein, and following productions in Leipzig (1962) and at Moscow’s Bolshoi Theater (1963) prompted an invitation to make a cinematic adaptation, the only film he ever made. Herz left the Komische Oper in 1981, possibly because of his dealings with the ensemble and GDR officials, and worked in London and Munich.After his death in 2010, the British magazineOpera Nownoted:“His Wagner productions in particular have proved ground-breaking, although his enormous contribution to revolutionary post-war changes in opera production has not always been acknowledged.”Free Entry!!
